subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The blood of Jesus, His Son, purifies us from all sin. (I Jn. 1:7)
reflection: It used to be we'd reach for the bottle of "white out, " bush it on our mistakes, and then type over them. Next came the erasing ribbon that lifted the type from the page so we could make our corrections. Now we have the computer with its delete key. How far we've come!!! Now sin is not just some "typo" on the page of life that we can correct. Each thought, word, and deed that goes astray offends God and earns us death. whiting out sin in our memories won't work. Regardless of what we try, the point remains to trouble us. Typing over sin with our own works won't do it either. Those efforts only smudge our sins, leaving them clearly visible to the divine judge. Even if we had some delete key for our sins, they'd still be in the computer trash file, damning us before God. There is only one way for sin to be erased. In fact, it's already been done. At Calvary when His Son said, "It is finished, " God hit the delete key on His heavenly computer. His Son's precious blood paid for every sin of every sinner. Yes the sins were totally erased.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to appreciate Jesus' precious blood. Amen.
original_content:
02/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE GREATEST DELETE KEY...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The blood of Jesus, His Son, purifies us from all sin... (I Jn. 1:7)

Our Lesson for Today:
It used to be we'd reach for the bottle of "white out," bush it on our mistakes,
and then type over them. Next came the erasing ribbon that lifted the type
from the page so we could make our corrections. Now we have the computer
with its delete key. How far we've come!!!

Now sin is not just some "typo" on the page of life that we can correct. Each
thought, word, and deed that goes astray offends God and earns us death.
whiting out sin in our memories won't work. Regardless of what we try, the
point remains to trouble us. Typing over sin with our own works won't do it
either. Those efforts only smudge our sins, leaving them clearly visible to the
divine judge. Even if we had some delete key for our sins, they'd still be in the
computer trash file, damning us before God...

There is only one way for sin to be erased. In fact, it's already been done.
At Calvary when His Son said, "It is finished," God hit the delete key on His 
heavenly computer. His Son's precious blood paid for every sin of every sinner...

Yes the sins were totally erased...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to appreciate Jesus'
precious blood...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For we are God's fellow workers; you are God's building. (I Cor. 3:9)
reflection: Much to often we look at a building with a beautiful steeple and call it the church, BUT God's church is not some stately building. The church is comprised of all believers in Christ. Its construction began in the Garden of Eden when God proclaimed the promise of a Savior. The Holy Spirit has been its general contractor throughout the years. His construction equipment has been the gospel in Word and sacrament. Through the good-news of forgiveness, He works in the hearts of people. He brings them in faith and mortars them as living stones into God's eternal church."Built by God" is not just some abstract theological truth. Its my comfort. Thank God for His work in my heart. What a gift of His grace that I am a part of His church.
prayer: Dear Lord, may the Spirit keep me mortared in Your church through the Gospel. Amen.
original_content:

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can to the Father except by Me...Jn. 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Like new born babies, crave pure spiritual milk, so that by it you may grow up in your salvation, now that you have tasted that the Lord is good. (I Pet. 2:2, 3)
reflection: One Characteristic all children share is that they want to grow up, to be like big brother or sister or like their parents. When we are born again, we become spiritual newborn babies. If we are healthy, we will yearn to grow. How sad it is that some never grow up. the need for milk is a natural instinct for a baby, and it signals the desire for nourishment that will lead to growth. Once we see our need for God's Word and begin to find nourishment in Christ, our spiritual appetite will increase, and we will start to mature. How strong is your desire for God's Word.
prayer: Dear Lord, give me an appetite for the Word that I may grow. Amen.
original_content:
02/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT DO YOU CRAVE???

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Like new born babies, crave pure spiritual milk, so that by it
you may grow up in your salvation, now that you have tasted 
that the Lord is good...(I Pet. 2:2, 3)

Our Lesson for Today:
One Characteristic all children share is that they want to grow up,
to be like big brother or sister or like their parents...

When we are born again, we become spiritual newborn babies.
If we are healthy, we will yearn to grow. How sad it is that some 
never grow up. the need for milk is a natural instinct for a baby,
and it signals the desire for nourishment that will lead to growth...

Once we see our need for God's Word and begin to find nourishment
in Christ, our spiritual appetite will increase, and we will start to mature.
How strong is your desire for God's Word...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, give me an appetite for the Word that I may grow...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Everyone who hears these words of Mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock. (Mt. 7:24)
reflection: Jesus has more in mind than a course in architectural design or intelligent house building. He's talking about lives and souls, about using our lives to be built on Him and readied for heaven. To build "on solid rock" means to be a hearing, responding disciple, not a phony, superficial one. Practicing obedience becomes the solid foundation to weather the storms of life. Take a look at James 1:22-27 for more on putting into practice what you hear.
prayer: "On Christ, the solid rock, I stand: All other ground is sinking sand." Lord, help me to pray so as to learn how to build a solid foundation. Amen.
original_content:
02/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~BE WISE ~ BUILD ON THE ROCK...

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: There is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ. (Ro. 8:1)
reflection: Every pastor has been asked and had to answer one particular question. Many Christians on a sickbed or in trouble have thought or said it."God must be punishing me for my sin, " Yes this has been the comment or, should we say the question. A troubled Christian needs an answer. We need to listen closer to Paul's words! "There is now no condemnation, " Write in the word punishment for condemnation, and you can see what he has in mind. There is no more punishment for me, no more sin that the righteous judge is singling out for which to hit me with. Can that be so? "Yes, " Paul says, "For those who are in Christ Jesus." Yes Christ Jesus has paid for all our sins, they are totally and completely gone. Because the Spirit has brought me to faith in Jesus I am wholly holy in God's eyes, cleansed from sin's every stain clothed with Jesus' robe of righteousness. Yes God has already charged Jesus for your sin and accepted the payment rendered. So how can He be charging us again for it???
prayer: Dear Lord, fill my heart with the peace that comes from knowing Jesus has paid for all my sins. Amen.
original_content:

Write in the word punishment for condemnation, and you can see what he

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "No eye has seen, no ear has heard, no mind has conceived, what God has prepared for those who love Him" ~ but God has revealed it to us by His Spirit. (I Cor. 2:9, 10)
reflection: People can try to tell us about the Savior. Preachers can try to point us to Him. But when they ask, "Can't you see Him?" our answer can only be "No." Yes! Such is our horrible legacy from our first parent's sin in the Garden of Eden. In our natural spiritual condition, God's wisdom of salvation in Christ is only foolishness. Until, THAT IS, God reveals His blessed truth to us by the Spirit. The Holy Spirit brings the Savior up close to us through the gospel. With the Word He not only points out Jesus but works to power faith within our unbelieving hearts. Not only does He ask, "Can't you see Him?" He also creates faith in us to know and trust Jesus as our only Savior. When the Holy Spirit does His work, I can see Jesus. And that's the most precious sight in the world.
prayer: Dear Lord I thank You for Your Holy Spirit's power to open my eyes to see and my heart to trust Jesus as my Savior. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For no matter how many promises God has made, they are "Yes" in Christ. (2 Cor. 1:20)
reflection: When God makes a promise, we can take His word for it. Isn't that what Christian faith is all about? "YES!" It is the confidence that whatever God says He means. Notice what Paul said. All of God's promises are "yes" in Christ. Everything He has promised for our salvation in Christ He has done. Everything else He promises for our lives, He will also surely do. Christ is God's "YES." in big letters and bold print, for all His claims. When He promises, "Take heart ~ your sins are for given" (Mt. 9:2) We can bank on His words. Not only does God promise, but in Christ He has put His powerful love behind all His claims.
prayer: Dear Lord, in Jesus show me that I can take You at Your word whenever You Speak. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: There He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light. (Mt. 17:2)
reflection: How do we describe the glory shining in Jesus' face and through His clothing that day? Not some outside glory beaming down on Him, but arising from within Him. A glory that far outshone the sun's brightest rays in the sky. The radiant glory of God Himself, for that's who Jesus is!!! From such a shining face, we can only fall back in fear. When God and man stand face-to-face, man must step aside. God wanted a face-to-face relationship with us. But Adam's sin spoiled it all. Now when God comes, sin's curse can only turn us away from His glorious face. We need to look from Jesus' holy face to His loving face. We need to learn what He has done with our sins so we can have that face-to-face relationship with Him already here on earth and forever in heaven.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, remind me how You made me holy by Your blood so I could see Your holy face. Amen.
original_content:
02/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~LET ME SEE HIS SHINING FACE...

There He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun,
and His clothes became as white as the light...(Mt. 17:2)

From such a shining face, we can only fall back in fear. When God and

relationship with us. But Adam's sin spoiled it all. Now when God comes,

We need to look from Jesus' holy face to His loving face. We need to learn

by Your blood so I could see Your holy face...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Two men, Moses and Elijah, appeared in glorious splendor, talking with Jesus. They spoke about His departure, which He was about to bring about to bring fulfillment at Jerusalem. (Lk. 9:30, 31)
reflection: What were they talking about? Well they went right to the heart of the matter ~ Jesus' death that was coming up in Jerusalem. The King James Version puts it in a strange way ~ Jesus would accomplish death. We suffer death; there's nothing we can do about it. But Jesus accomplished death. That was a part of His work of salvation. The cup of suffering with every bitter drop, the cross of nails with every bitter pain, the open tomb with every blessed comfort, the salvation of the world ~ this He was going to bring to fulfillment. AND this is what they talked about on that mountain top. Yes we would like to stay forever on that mountain top and bask in the sunshine of such love. But like the disciples we have to walk down into the sin- and tearfilled plains of life. And it's down there that Jesus' love becomes very real for us. YES, in daily life, where joy and sorrow, laughter and tears run together, we need to know that Jesus loves us.
prayer: Dear Lord, let the sight of Your loving face assure me of Your salvation and strength for my life. Amen.
original_content:
02/10/09~~~food for thought~~~LET ME SEE YOUR LOVING FACE...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Two men, Moses and Elijah, appeared in glorious splendor, talking with
Jesus. They spoke about His departure, which He was about to bring about
to bring fulfillment at Jerusalem...(Lk. 9:30, 31)

Our Lesson for Today:
What were they talking about? Well they went right to the heart of the matter ~
Jesus' death that was coming up in Jerusalem. The King James Version puts
it in a strange way ~ Jesus would accomplish death. We suffer death; there's
nothing we can do about it...

But Jesus accomplished death. That was a part of His work of salvation. The
cup of suffering with every bitter drop, the cross of nails with every bitter pain,
the open tomb with every blessed comfort, the salvation of the world ~ this He
was going to bring to fulfillment. AND this is what they talked about on that
mountain top...

Yes we would like to stay forever on that mountain top and bask in the sunshine 
of such love. But like the disciples we have to walk down into the sin- and tearfilled plains of life. And it's down there that Jesus' love becomes very real for
us. YES, in daily life, where joy and sorrow, laughter and tears run together, we
need to know that Jesus loves us.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, let the sight of Your loving face assure me of
Your salvation and strength for my life...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Peter and the others were very drowsy and had fallen asleep. Now they woke up and saw Jesus' glory and the two other men standing with Him. As Moses and Elijah were starting to leave, Peter, not even knowing what he was saying, blurted out, "Master, this is wonderful! We will make three shrines ~ one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
reflection: "Master this is wonderful!" Peter James and John experienced a wonderful moment on the mountain and didn't want to leave. Sometimes we too have such an inspiring experience that we want to stay where we are, away from the reality and problems of our daily life. Knowing that struggles await us in the valley encourages us to want to linger on the mountaintop. BUT staying on top of the mountain prohibits our ministering to others. Thus instead of becoming spiritual giants we would soon become dwarfed by our self-centeredness. Yes we do need times of retreat and renewal, BUT only so we can return to minister to the world. Our faith must make sense off the mountain as well as on it.
prayer: Dear Lord I do thank You for the mountain top experiences, but I also pray that You would help me to see that I need the valley experiences, that I may grow in my faith. Amen.
original_content:
02/11/2010~~~food for thought~~~GROWING IN OUR VALLEYS

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Peter and the others were very drowsy and had fallen asleep. Now they 
woke up and saw Jesus' glory and the two other men standing with Him.
As Moses and Elijah were starting to leave, Peter, not even knowing what
he was saying, blurted out, "Master, this is wonderful! We will make three 
shrines ~ one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."

Our Lesson for Today:
"Master this is wonderful!" Peter James and John experienced a 
wonderful moment on the mountain and didn't want to leave.

Sometimes we too have such an inspiring experience that we want to stay
where we are, away from the reality and problems of our daily life. Knowing
that struggles await us in the valley encourages us to want to linger on the
mountaintop. 

BUT staying on top of the mountain prohibits our ministering to others. 
Thus instead of becoming spiritual giants we would soon become 
dwarfed by our self-centeredness.

Yes we do need times of retreat and renewal, BUT only so we can return to minister
to the world. Our faith must make sense off the mountain as well as on it...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord I do thank You for the mountain top experiences,
but I also pray that You would help me to see that I need the
valley experiences, that I may grow in my faith...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ and this not from yourselves, it is the gift of God ~ not by works, so that no one can boast. (Eph. 2:8, 9)
reflection: Do I understand that people are carried to heaven not because of what they do or don't do but because of God's generosity? ~ Do I appreciate that people enter God's heaven purely through His grace? ~ Grace is the rich word for some gift completely undeserved, something I in no way have coming. Why should God send His Son to rescue me from an eternity in hell that I so richly deserve? ~ Why should He single me out of the sea of humanity to hear the news of His Salvation? ~ Why should He struggle with my rebellious heart and bring me to faith in Jesus as my only Savior? ~ WHY? WHY? WHY? Grace is the only word that fits ~ it really is! It is as our Bible verse today says: "By grace you have been saved ~ through faith ~ it is the gift of God ~ not by works ~ so that no one can boast." Our faith is not even something we can boast about it too is a gift.
prayer: Thank You Lord, for Your love, mercy, and grace that saved a wretch like me. Amen.
original_content:
02/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~GRACE SAYS IT ALL

Our Bible Verses for Today:
For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith ~ and this
not from yourselves, it is the gift of God ~ not by works, so that
no one can boast...(Eph. 2:8, 9)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do I understand that people are carried to heaven not because of what 
they do or don't do but because of God's generosity? ~ Do I appreciate
that people enter God's heaven purely through His grace? ~ Grace is
the rich word for some gift completely undeserved, something I in no
way have coming...

Why should God send His Son to rescue me from an eternity in hell that 
I so richly deserve? ~ Why should He single me out of the sea of humanity 
to hear the news of His Salvation? ~ Why should He struggle with my rebellious
heart and bring me to faith in Jesus as my only Savior? ~ WHY? WHY? WHY?

Grace is the only word that fits ~ it really is! It is as our Bible verse today says:
"By grace you have been saved ~ through faith ~ it is the gift of God ~ 
not by works ~ so that no one can boast." Our faith is not even something
we can boast about it too is a gift...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord, for Your love, mercy, and grace that saved
a wretch like me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "If you forgive those who sin against you, Your heavenly Father will forgive you. But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father will not forgive your sins. (Mt. 6:14, 15)
reflection: What a startling warning Jesus gives about forgiveness. If we refuse to forgive others, God will also refuse to forgive us. WHY? Because when we don't forgive others, we are denying our common ground as sinners in need of God's forgiveness. God's forgiveness of sin is not the direct result of our forgiving others, but it is based on our realizing what forgiveness means (Eph. 4:32). YES it is easy to ask God for forgiveness but very difficult to grant it to others. Whenever we ask God to forgive us for sins we have committed, we should ask, "Have I forgiven the people who have wronged me?
prayer: Dear Lord, give me a forgiving heart so that I might receive Your forgiveness. Amen.
original_content:
02/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT I NEED TO DO, THAT I MAY 
RECEIVE GOD'S FORGIVENESS

"If you forgive those who sin against you, Your heavenly Father
will forgive you. But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father

What a startling warning Jesus gives about forgiveness. If we refuse
to forgive others, God will also refuse to forgive us. WHY? Because
when we don't forgive others, we are denying our common ground as
sinners in need of God's forgiveness...

God's forgiveness of sin is not the direct result of our forgiving others,
but it is based on our realizing what forgiveness means (Eph. 4:32). YES

Whenever we ask God to forgive us for sins we have committed, we should

receive Your forgiveness...Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down His life for us. (I Jn. 3:16)
reflection: "Will you be my valentine?" Remember cards like that? Remember when we used to send them? Perhaps we still do to show our love for someone special. Have you ever stopped to think that everyday is Valentines Day with God? He doesn't limit His show of love to one day a year. He loves every day and has been doing so since the world began. He doesn't merely say, "I love you, " or simply send a card. He shows His love in actions. How did He show His love to me this past week? Well it could have been in the form of family members who laughed with me when I was happy and cried with me when I was sad. Or in the form of strength against temptation. or healing for a hurting body. It could be in success in some venture, and guidance for some decision. Yes God's love flows down on us constantly. Every day His love sends us a valentine. Best of all Jesus loved us so much He willingly took our place on the cross so sin's punishment might be paid in full.
prayer: Dear Lord, I need Your Love every day. Please be my valentine today and always. Amen.
original_content:
02/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~EVERY DAY IS A VALENTINE'S DAY...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down 
His life for us. (I Jn. 3:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
"Will you be my valentine?" Remember cards like that? Remember when
we used to send them? Perhaps we still do to show our love for someone
special...

Have you ever stopped to think that everyday is Valentines Day with God?
He doesn't limit His show of love to one day a year. He loves every day and
has been doing so since the world began. He doesn't merely say, "I love you," 
or simply send a card. He shows His love in actions.

How did He show His love to me this past week? Well it could have been in the 
form of family members who laughed with me when I was happy and cried with 
me when I was sad. Or in the form of strength against temptation. or healing for
a hurting body. It could be in success in some venture, and guidance for some 
decision.

Yes God's love flows down on us constantly. Every day His love sends us a valentine.
Best of all Jesus loved us so much He willingly took our place on the cross so sin's
punishment might be paid in full...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I need Your Love every day. Please be my valentine
today and always...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Our citizenship is in heaven. And we eagerly await a Savior from there, the Lord Jesus Christ. (Phil. 3:20)
reflection: After being gone for a week we usually long for home. I believe that every Christian knows that feeling. Except, the home for which believers long for is a heavenly one. We love to sing, "I'm but a stranger here. Heaven is my home." At funerals the words bring tears to our eyes. BUT we still have to live in this world and use the things of this world. But God help us live as one just passing through, not as one who is trying to put down permanent roots. Lord help us rejoice that our name is recorded in Your book of life in heaven. God help us treasure the blessings we have as a citizen of heaven ~ forgiveness of every sin, help for every trouble, comfort for every sorrow, and heaven in the end. Yes, heaven in the end."We eagerly await a Savior from there." When that day comes, We'll see heaven's flag waving and be truly at home with the Lord.
prayer: Dear Lord, keep me safe as a pilgrim in this world till You take me to my heavenly home. Amen.
original_content:

that every Christian knows that feeling. Except, the home for which 
believers long for is a heavenly one. We love to sing, "I'm but a stranger
here. Heaven is my home." At funerals the words bring tears to our eyes.

BUT we still have to live in this world and use the things of this world.
But God help us live as one just passing through, not as one who is trying

When that day comes, We'll see heaven's flag waving and be truly at home 
with the Lord...

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The tempter came to Jesus and said, "If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread." Jesus answered, "It is written: Man does not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God." (Mt. 4:3, 4)
reflection: Do the words of Satan sound familiar? "IF, " If you are God's child, how come you have trouble?" "How come you're sick?" "How come your loved ONE has cancer or your teenager is rebellious." Yes Satan always begins with that ridiculous little word "IF". What are we to do? LOOK TO JESUS!!! "The reason the Son of God appeared was to destroy the devil's work, " Scripture tells us in (1 Jn 3:8). now when Satan knocks on my heart's door, I can say, "Away from me." Satan can't win when Christ fights alongside me.
prayer: Dear Lord, strengthen me when the devil attacks so that You and I together gain the victory. Amen.
original_content:
02/16/2010~~~food for thought~~~VICTORY IN JESUS!!!

Our Bible Verses for Today:
The tempter came to Jesus and said, "If you are the Son of God, tell these stones 
to become bread." Jesus answered, "It is written: Man does not live by bread alone,
but by every word that comes from the mouth of God." (Mt. 4:3, 4)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do the words of Satan sound familiar? "IF," If you are God's child, how come 
you have trouble?" "How come you're sick?" "How come your loved ONE has 
cancer or your teenager is rebellious." Yes Satan always begins with that ridiculous 
little word "IF".

What are we to do? LOOK TO JESUS!!! "The reason the Son of God appeared
was to destroy the devil's work," Scripture tells us in (1 Jn 3:8). now when Satan 
knocks on my heart's door, I can say, "Away from me." Satan can't win when Christ 
fights alongside me...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, strengthen me when the devil attacks so that
You and I together gain the victory...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Then the devil took Him (Jesus) to the holy city and had Him stand on the highest point of the temple."If you are the Son of God, " he said, "throw Yourself down." Jesus answered him, "It is written: do not put the Lord your God to the test." (Mt. 4:5-7)
reflection: "Try God out, " Satan urged Christ with yet another temptation. Here we see again that little "if" "If you are the Son of God, throw Yourself down." And then he even quoted from Psalm 91 about how God has promised to protect His own. Watch out when the prince of darkness masquerades as an angel of light. God is to be trusted, not tested. His promises are to be humbly believed. In such cases what are we to do? There is only one thing to do, Look to Jesus."It is written, " He answered, sending Satan flying with the cutting edge of God's almighty Word. If we would swing the sword of the Spirit at Satan, he has to duck. When we train to fight with God's Almighty Word, Satan has to slink in defeat.
prayer: Dear Lord, train me in Your Word so that I am armed for battle. Amen.
original_content:
02/17/2010~~~food for thought~~~BY FAITH WE ELIMINATE THE "IFS" IN LIFE...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Then the devil took Him (Jesus) to the holy city and had Him stand
on the highest point of the temple."If you are the Son of God," he
said, "throw Yourself down..." Jesus answered him, "It is written:
do not put the Lord your God to the test." (Mt. 4:5-7)

Our Lesson for Today:
"Try God out," Satan urged Christ with yet another temptation. Here we see again
that little "if" "If you are the Son of God, throw Yourself down." And then he even
quoted from Psalm 91 about how God has promised to protect His own...

Watch out when the prince of darkness masquerades as an angel of light. God
is to be trusted, not tested. His promises are to be humbly believed. In such
cases what are we to do? There is only one thing to do, Look to Jesus."It is written," 
He answered, sending Satan flying with the cutting edge of God's almighty Word...

If we would swing the sword of the Spirit at Satan, he has to duck. When we train
to fight with God's Almighty Word, Satan has to slink in defeat...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, train me in Your Word so that I am armed for battle...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "All this I will give you, " he [Satan] said, "if you will bow down and worship me." Jesus said to him, "Away from me Satan! For it is written:" 'Worship the Lord your God, and serve Him only. ' " (Mt. 4:9, 10)
reflection: "Take the easy way, " Satan was telling Christ in this third temptation. Here's a kingdom without a crown of thorns and without a cross of nails to be had just for bowing down before me." Sound familiar? "Why work so hard? Look at what others get away with." Why not let down the standards and loosen the doctrine?" Satan hints to the church member."Take the easy way, " he tells us as he magically brings before our eyes the things of this world. What to do? ~ One thing only, Look to Jesus. Through Jesus, we who believe will one day stand in heaven, not only cleansed from our sins against the First Commandment but with its perfect keeping in our hand. On it will be printed, "Made by Jesus Christ."
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for keeping God's commandments and making it count for me. Amen.

"All this I will give you," he [Satan] said, "if you will bow down and worship me."
Jesus said to him, "Away from me Satan! For it is written:" 'Worship the Lord

kingdom without a crown of thorns and without a cross of nails to be had just 
for bowing down before me."

Sound familiar? "Why work so hard? Look at what others get away with."
Why not let down the standards and loosen the doctrine?" Satan hints to

and making it count for me...Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Martha came to Jesus and said, "Lord, doesn't it seem unfair to You that my sister just sits here while I do all the work? But the Lord said to her, "My dear Martha, you are so upset over all these details! There is really only one thing worth being concerned about. Mary has discovered it ~ and I won't take it away from her." (Lk. 10:40, 41, 42)
reflection: Martha didn't realize that in her desire to serve, she was actually neglecting her guest. Are you so busy doing things for Jesus that you're not spending any time with Him? Don't let your service become self serving. Jesus did not blame Martha for being concerned about household chores. He was only asking her to set priorities. It is possible for service to Christ to degenerate into mere busywork that is totally devoid of devotion to God. (Phil. 3:13, 14; Ps. 27:4)
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to not let my desire to serve become self serving. Amen.
original_content:
02/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~A QUIET SPIRIT LISTENS TO JESUS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Martha came to Jesus and said, "Lord, doesn't it seem unfair to You that
my sister just sits here while I do all the work? But the Lord said to her, 
"My dear Martha, you are so upset over all these details! There is really 
only one thing worth being concerned about. Mary has discovered it ~ 
and I won't take it away from her." (Lk. 10: 40, 41, 42)

Our Lesson for Today:
Martha didn't realize that in her desire to serve, she was actually neglecting
her guest. Are you so busy doing things for Jesus that you're not spending
any time with Him? Don't let your service become self serving...

Jesus did not blame Martha for being concerned about household chores.
He was only asking her to set priorities. It is possible for service to Christ
to degenerate into mere busywork that is totally devoid of devotion to God...
(Phil. 3:13, 14; Ps. 27:4)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to not let my desire to serve 
become self serving...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We know how dearly God loves us, because He has given us the Holy Spirit to fill our hearts with His love. (Ro. 5:5)
reflection: All three members of the Trinity are involved in salvation. The Father loved us so much that He sent His Son to bridge the gap between us (Jn. 3:16). The Father and the Son send the Holy Spirit to fill our life with love and enable us to live by His power (Acts 1:8). With all this loving care, how can we do less than serve Him completely!!!
prayer: Dear Lord, fill me with Your amazing love so that I can become an instrument of Your love. Amen.
original_content:
02/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~LOVE LIVES FOR JESUS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
We know how dearly God loves us, because He has given
us the Holy Spirit to fill our hearts with His love. (Ro. 5:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
All three members of the Trinity are involved in salvation.
The Father loved us so much that He sent His Son to
bridge the gap between us (Jn. 3:16)...

The Father and the Son send the Holy Spirit to fill our life with
love and enable us to live by His power (Acts 1:8). With all this
loving care, how can we do less than serve Him completely!!!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill me with Your amazing love so that I can
become an instrument of Your love...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "You search the Scriptures because you believe they give you eternal life. But the Scriptures point to Me! ~ Yet you refuse to come to Me so that I can give you this eternal life. (Jn. 5:39, 40)
reflection: The religious leaders knew what the Bible said but failed to apply its words to their lives. They knew the teachings of the Scriptures but failed to see the Messiah to whom the Scriptures pointed. They knew the rules but missed the Savior. ~ WHY? ~ It was because they were so hung-up on their own religious systems, that they refused to let the Son of God change their lives. Today People are so hung-up on the ways of the world, that they refuse to let the Savior change their lives. Let us not become so involved in the world or "religion" that we miss Christ. Only Christ can save, not a bunch of "religious" rituals.
prayer: Dear Lord, as I open the Scriptures help me to see Jesus, my Savior standing there. Amen.
original_content:
02/21/2010~~~food for thought~~~SEARCHING FOR THE TRUTH...

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"You search the Scriptures because you believe they give you eternal life.
But the Scriptures point to Me! ~ Yet you refuse to come to Me so that I
can give you this eternal life...(Jn. 5:39, 40)

Our Lesson for Today:
The religious leaders knew what the Bible said but failed to apply its words 
to their lives. They knew the teachings of the Scriptures but failed to see
the Messiah to whom the Scriptures pointed...

They knew the rules but missed the Savior. ~ WHY? ~ It was because 
they were so hung-up on their own religious systems, that they refused to
let the Son of God change their lives...

Today People are so hung-up on the ways of the world, that they refuse to
let the Savior change their lives. Let us not become so involved in the world
or "religion" that we miss Christ...

Only Christ can save, not a bunch of "religious" rituals...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, as I open the Scriptures help me to see
Jesus, my Savior standing there...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus speaking ~ Can any of you prove Me guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don't you believe Me? (Jn. 8:46)
reflection: Who can we believe these days? We've learned to take the words of the salesman, the politician, and others with a "grain of salt." the more they urge us, "Believe me, " the more we back away. Thank God, there is one Person we can believe - totally. What He says, we can trust - completely. Why do we need a sinless Jesus? ~ Because a sinless Jesus is one who never speaks a lie or stretches the truth. When He says He will never leave us or forsake us, we can take it as gospel truth. When He says our sins are plunged into the depths of the sea, that promise also stands sure as the heavens above. When He says He will walk with us through the shadow, He's going to be there. Jesus says, "Believe Me." ~ How foolish not to!!!
prayer: Yes, Lord, I believe, by Your grace and the Spirit's working. Help me to always do so. Amen.
original_content:
02/22/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHY DON'T YOU BELIEVE???

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus speaking ~ Can any of you prove Me guilty of sin? If I am
telling the truth, why don't you believe Me? (Jn. 8:46)

Our Lesson for Today:
Who can we believe these days? We've learned to take the words of the
salesman, the politician, and others with a "grain of salt." the more they urge
us, "Believe me," the more we back away. Thank God, there is one Person 
we can believe - totally. What He says, we can trust - completely...

Why do we need a sinless Jesus? ~ Because a sinless Jesus is one who 
never speaks a lie or stretches the truth. When He says He will never leave us 
or forsake us, we can take it as gospel truth. When He says our sins are plunged
into the depths of the sea, that promise also stands sure as the heavens above.
When He says He will walk with us through the shadow, He's going to be there. 

Jesus says, "Believe Me." ~ How foolish not to!!!

Prayer Suggestion:
Yes, Lord, I believe, by Your grace and the Spirit's working.
Help me to always do so...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I tell you the truth, if anyone keeps my word, he will never see death." (Jn. 8:51)
reflection: I think that most would agree, that the fear of death is universal. So when Jesus spoke about never seeing death, wouldn't we have expected those Pharisees to sit up and pay attention? When He promised that those who hear and believe His Word would never have to set foot in hell, shouldn't they have been listening with wide-open ears? I don't much like death either. It's not my favorite topic of conversation. NOR is there any greater grief than caused by the loss of a loved one. BUT we don't have to be afraid of death. Not since Jesus filled Calvary's cross and emptied Joseph's tomb. YES, "The wages of sin is death, " and that is what the sinless Son of God came to pay. He carried our sins on His sinless shoulders, in Him I have the guarantee that I shall live forever. Jesus says, "Believe Me." How foolish not to!
prayer: Yes, Lord, I believe ~ by Your grace and the Spirit's working. Help me to always do so. Amen.
original_content:
02/23/2010~~~LIFE - GIVING IN HIS WORD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I tell you the truth, if anyone keeps my word, he will
never see death." (Jn. 8:51)

Our Lesson for Today:
I think that most would agree, that the fear of death is universal.
So when Jesus spoke about never seeing death, wouldn't we have expected
those Pharisees to sit up and pay attention?

When He promised that those who hear and believe His Word would never have
to set foot in hell, shouldn't they have been listening with wide-open ears?

I don't much like death either. It's not my favorite topic of conversation. NOR is there
any greater grief than caused by the loss of a loved one. BUT we don't have to 
be afraid of death. Not since Jesus filled Calvary's cross and emptied Joseph's tomb.

YES, "The wages of sin is death," and that is what the sinless Son of God came to pay.
He carried our sins on His sinless shoulders, in Him I have the guarantee that I shall live 
forever. Jesus says, "Believe Me." How foolish not to!

Prayer Suggestion:
Yes, Lord, I believe ~ by Your grace and the Spirit's working.
Help me to always do so...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I tell you the truth, " Jesus answered, "before Abraham was born, I am!" (Jn. 8:58)
reflection: This is one of the most powerful statements Jesus ever made. When He said that He existed before Abraham was born, He undeniably proclaimed His divinity. ~ Not only did Jesus say He existed before Abraham; He also applied God's holy name (I AM ~ Exodus 3:14) to Himself. This name demands a response ~ It cannot be ignored. YES Jesus is God! How have you responded to Jesus, the Son of God?
prayer: By Your Spirit's power help me to become more personal with Your Son, my Lord, Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_content:
02/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~HIS EXISTENCE IS ETERNAL...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I tell you the truth," Jesus answered, "before Abraham was born, I am!" (Jn. 8:58)

Our Lesson for Today:
This is one of the most powerful statements Jesus ever made. When He
said that He existed before Abraham was born, He undeniably proclaimed 
His divinity. ~ Not only did Jesus say He existed before Abraham; He also
applied God's holy name (I AM ~ Exodus 3:14) to Himself...

This name demands a response ~ It cannot be ignored. YES Jesus is God!
How have you responded to Jesus, the Son of God?

Prayer Suggestion:
By Your Spirit's power help me to become more personal
with Your Son, my Lord, Jesus Christ...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When Jesus landed and step out of the boat He saw the large crowd, He had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So He began teaching them many things. (Mk. 6:34)
reflection: This crowd was as pitiful as a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Sheep are easily scattered; without a shepherd they are in grave danger. Yes Jesus calls us all sheep, sheep who have gone astray. Jesus is the Shepherd who can teach us what we need to know to keep us from straying from God. How does one find Jesus. WELL if you don't know, He is in that dusty Book on your end table, or He may have even ended up in that Book on the shelf of your bedroom closet. Lets find that book again, Jesus is waiting there to feed you, the Bread of Life.
prayer: Dear Lord, feed me from Your Book, the Bread of Heaven. so that once again my soul will be satisfied. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were seated as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish. (Jn. 6:11)
reflection: By our Bible verse for today do you realize what happens when you allow Jesus to take over? In His powerful hands, the fish sandwiches grew into enough to feed the crowd. When all were satisfied, more was left over than what the boy had even started with. Don't you wonder if the disciples ever forgot the powerful lesson learned that day? OH how the Lord provides for the needs of the body. Do we really remember or do we forget? Yes Christians too have needs, the difference lies in our reaction. Some one once said, "There are three ways to react to trouble. You can take it on the chin. You can take to drink. You can turn to religion." Where do I turn? He who served up fish sandwiches to the crowd that day will supply what I need.
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to lay all my cares on You, trusting that You care for me. Amen.
original_content:
02/26/2010~~~food for thought~~~SANDWICHES FOR THE STOMACH...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were 
seated as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish...(Jn. 6:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
By our Bible verse for today do you realize what happens when you allow Jesus
to take over? In His powerful hands, the fish sandwiches grew into enough to feed
the crowd. When all were satisfied, more was left over than what the boy had even 
started with...

Don't you wonder if the disciples ever forgot the powerful lesson learned that day?
OH how the Lord provides for the needs of the body. Do we really remember or do

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus took the twelve aside and told them, "We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled." (Lk. 18:31)
reflection: Here are some of the predictions of what would happen to Jesus: Ps. 41:9 (the betrayal) ~ Isa. 53:4-7 (crucifixion) ~ Ps. 16:10 (resurrection) The disciples had all these predictions, yet they didn't understand Jesus, apparently because they were more focused on what He said about His death and ignored what He said about His resurrection. Even though Jesus spoke plainly, they would not OR could not grasp the significance of His words UNTIL they saw the risen Christ face to face. Even though we have the New Testament which tells us "The wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ or Lord." (Ro. 6:23), many ignore the "wages part" but expect the "free gift" part. Yes we are free to choose between two masters, (sin or Christ Jesus) it is either one or the other. You can not serve both.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me each day to serve Christ so that I might receive Your free gift of eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
02/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~IT IS FINISHED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus took the twelve aside and told them, "We are going up to Jerusalem, 
and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be
fulfilled." (Lk. 18:31)

Our Lesson for Today:
Here are some of the predictions of what would happen to Jesus:
Ps. 41:9 (the betrayal) ~ Isa. 53:4-7 (crucifixion) ~ Ps. 16:10 (resurrection)

The disciples had all these predictions, yet they didn't understand Jesus, apparently 
because they were more focused on what He said about His death and ignored what 
He said about His resurrection...Even though Jesus spoke plainly, they would not OR 
could not grasp the significance of His words UNTIL they saw the risen Christ face to 
face.

Even though we have the New Testament which tells us "The wages of sin is death,
but the free gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ or Lord." (Ro. 6:23), many
ignore the "wages part" but expect the "free gift" part...

Yes we are free to choose between two masters, (sin or Christ Jesus) it is either one 
or the other. You can not serve both...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me each day to serve Christ so that
I might receive Your free gift of eternal life...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He poured water into a basin and began to wash His disciples feet, drying them with the towel that He wrapped around Him. (Jn. 13:5)
reflection: What a model servant Jesus portrayed to His disciples. Washing guests feet was a job for a household servant to carry out when guests arrived. But Jesus wrapped a towel around His waist, as the lowliest slave would do, and washed and dried His disciples' feet. If even He, God in the flesh, is willing to serve, we His followers must also be servant, willing to serve in any way that glorifies God. ~ Are you willing to follow Christ's example of serving? ~ Whom can you serve today? There is a special blessing for those who not only agree that humble service is Christ's way, but who also follow through and do it. In (Jn. 13:17). Jesus says, "You know these things ~ now do them! That is the path of blessing."
prayer: Dear Lord, wash not just my feet but all of me with Your cleansing blood. Amen.
original_content:
02/28/2010~~~food for thought~~~HE WASHED THEIR FEET...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He poured water into a basin and began to wash His disciples feet,
drying them with the towel that He wrapped around Him...(Jn. 13:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
What a model servant Jesus portrayed to His disciples. Washing guests feet was 
a job for a household servant to carry out when guests arrived. But Jesus wrapped
a towel around His waist, as the lowliest slave would do, and washed and dried His
disciples' feet.

If even He, God in the flesh, is willing to serve, we His followers must also be servant,
willing to serve in any way that glorifies God. ~ Are you willing to follow Christ's example 
of serving? ~ Whom can you serve today?

There is a special blessing for those who not only agree that humble service is Christ's 
way, but who also follow through and do it. In (Jn. 13:17). Jesus says, "You know these 
things ~ now do them! That is the path of blessing."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, wash not just my feet but all of me
with Your cleansing blood...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He was delivered over to death for our sins. (Ro. 4:25)
reflection: Were you there? "Yes, " we answer gladly on some occasions. BUT not so gladly if it's an unpleasant situation. HOW ABOUT when asked "Were you there when they crucified my Lord?" Do we always pick up on the little pronoun in our verse? "Our sins, " Paul said. ~ Oh how quick we pick up on the sins of others in Christ's death. ~ Like the hatred of the Jewish leaders, ~ the cowardice of Pilate, ~ Judas' greed, ~ and the disciples' faintheartedness. BUT what we see so easily in others seems to remain unseen in ourselves. BUT Paul has set the record straight with that pronoun "our." ~ My shortcomings, which no paint can cover up regardless how thick I apply it, were part of the Calvary equation. YES soldiers swung the hammer, but my sins pierced Him. Hell chained Him in its torments, but my sins forged some of the links. There when they crucified my Lord? Thank God, my happy answer can be "Yes" there seeing and believing what God's love did with all my sins.
prayer: Thank You, Lord, for being there a Calvary as the only one who could pay for my sins. Amen.
original_content:
03/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~WERE YOU THERE?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He was delivered over to death for our sins...(Ro. 4:25)

Our Lesson for Today:
Were you there? "Yes," we answer gladly on some occasions. BUT
not so gladly if it's an unpleasant situation. HOW ABOUT when asked
"Were you there when they crucified my Lord?"

Do we always pick up on the little pronoun in our verse? "Our sins,"
Paul said. ~ Oh how quick we pick up on the sins of others in Christ's
death. ~ Like the hatred of the Jewish leaders, ~ the cowardice of 
Pilate, ~ Judas' greed, ~ and the disciples' faintheartedness...

BUT what we see so easily in others seems to remain unseen in ourselves.
BUT Paul has set the record straight with that pronoun "our." ~ My
shortcomings, which no paint can cover up regardless how thick I apply
it, were part of the Calvary equation...

YES soldiers swung the hammer, but my sins pierced Him. Hell chained
Him in its torments, but my sins forged some of the links. There when they
crucified my Lord? Thank God, my happy answer can be "Yes" there seeing 
and believing what God's love did with all my sins...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for being there a Calvary as the only
one who could pay for my sins...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to The Father except through me." - John: 14:6
